node.statement: Establish the combinatorial foundation: The Bell number B_n counts the number of partitions of an n-element set into non-empty disjoint subsets. By definition, B_n = sum_{k=0}^{n} S(n,k) where S(n,k) is the Stirling number of the second kind, counting partitions of [n] into exactly k non-empty blocks. This identity is foundational for connecting Bell numbers to the exponential generating function approach and for establishing the key identity k^n = sum_{j=0}^{k} S(n,j) * j! * C(k,j) used in the proof.
